techmeme.title: A survey of 730 software engineers: 75% have tried AI, 35.6% are AI optimists and 38.4% pessimists, freelance coders use AI more, 50% pay for AI tools, and more (Wired)
Google confirms a "technical issue" on Google Maps "that caused the deletion of Timeline data for some people", but says those with backups can restore the data (Hadlee Simons/Android Authority)
SAP's stock rose ~1.6% to give it a ~€314B market cap, passing Danish weight-loss drug maker Novo as Europe's most valuable public company; SAP is up 42% YTD (Henry Ren/Bloomberg)
Q&A with Reid Hoffman on making people AI-curious through his new book Superagency, writing with AI, why AI "gloomers" are wrong, tech's DEI rollback, and more (The Guardian)
An off-Broadway theater in New York is offering AI-powered live translations in 60 languages to attract new audiences, using AI tech from startup Worldly (Rachyl Jones/Semafor)
